page.title: 13RELIGION
page.content: SAINT NICHOLAS CHURCH BRAMCOTE The church can accommodate 700 people. It was dedicated in November 1968. The name St. Nicholas was retainedd from the time when the Admiralty were at Bramcote. St Nicholas is the patron saint if seamen. One of the stained glass windows holds a picture of St. Barbara,the patron saint of artillery men.There are close links with the Diocese of Coventry in the churh. The font is made of carved stonework from the old bombed cathedal. The Coventry Cross of Nails and "Father Forgive" are incorporated in the design. The organ has a unique history, having done over a hundred years service in the Bermuda Naval Dockyard Chapel, West Indies. The church is octagonal (eight sided) in shape.Services are held on Sundays and Thursdays.
